articles.headline: How Not to Make a Deal
articles.snippet: Yahoo may look like the big loser. But here’s a lesson for Microsoft: When you make an unsolicited offer, be prepared to win.
articles.abstract: Yahoo may look like the big loser. But here’s a lesson for Microsoft: When you make an unsolicited offer, be prepared to win.
articles.lead_paragraph: So after all that, Steven A. Ballmer looks like all hat, no cattle.

articles.headline: Doubts Raised on Big Backers of Mortgages
articles.snippet: Regulators are asking whether Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac will soon need saving themselves.
articles.abstract: Regulators are asking whether Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac will soon need saving themselves.
articles.lead_paragraph: As home prices continue their free fall and banks shy away from lending, Washington officials have increasingly relied on two giant mortgage companies  Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac  to keep the housing market afloat.

articles.headline: In Democracy Kuwait Trusts, but Not Much
articles.snippet: Overshadowed by thriving monarchies, Kuwaitis are wondering if democracy is living up to its promises.
articles.abstract: Overshadowed by thriving monarchies, Kuwaitis are wondering if democracy is living up to its promises.
articles.lead_paragraph: KUWAIT  In a vast, high-ceilinged tent, Ali al-Rashed sounded an anguished note as he delivered the first speech of his campaign for Parliament.

articles.headline: Google Ends Microsoft’s Yahoo Search
articles.snippet: Google played the odd dual role of unwitting matchmaker and self-interested spoiler in the failed marriage.
articles.abstract: Google played the odd dual role of unwitting matchmaker and self-interested spoiler in the failed marriage.
articles.lead_paragraph: Microsoft and Yahoo were pushed to the brink of a multibillion-dollar marriage and then to a sudden breakup this weekend by the same player.

articles.headline: For Primaries in 2 States, a Variety of Scenarios
articles.snippet: For political, demographic and mathematical reasons, Tuesday’s primaries in North Carolina and Indiana could reshape the race.
articles.abstract: For political, demographic and mathematical reasons, Tuesday’s primaries in North Carolina and Indiana could reshape the race.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s almost over.Well, not quite. But the Democratic presidential primaries taking place on Tuesday in North Carolina and Indiana have more delegates up for grabs than any of the remaining contests. For political, demographic and mathematical reasons, those states have the potential to reshape the competition between Senators Hillary Rodham Clinton and Barack Obama.

articles.headline: Economic Troubles Affect the Vegas Strip
articles.snippet: The gambling center seemed immune to the economic swings of the rest of the country. But the city built on excess is seeing a troubling sign: moderation.
articles.abstract: The gambling center seemed immune to the economic swings of the rest of the country. But the city built on excess is seeing a troubling sign: moderation.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS  For decades, this gambling center seemed nearly immune to the economic swings of the rest of the country. But these days, the city built on excess is seeing a troubling sign: moderation.

articles.headline: Myanmar Reels as Cyclone Toll Hits Thousands
articles.snippet: As the death toll from a devastating cyclone escalated to nearly 4,000, the foreign minister said that it could rise to 15,000.
articles.abstract: As the death toll from a devastating cyclone escalated to nearly 4,000, the foreign minister said that it could rise to 15,000.
articles.lead_paragraph: Myanmar struggled Monday to recover from a cyclone that killed more than 3,900 people and perhaps as many as 15,000.

articles.headline: Acquisition of Lender Is Possibly in Jeopardy
articles.snippet: Wall Street is buzzing that Bank of America’s offer for Countrywide Financial Corporation, the troubled mortgage giant, may be unraveling.
articles.abstract: Wall Street is buzzing that Bank of America’s offer for Countrywide Financial Corporation, the troubled mortgage giant, may be unraveling.
articles.lead_paragraph: Is Kenneth D. Lewis getting cold feet?

articles.headline: Yahoo Chief Says Microsoft Was the Stubborn One
articles.snippet: Jerry Yang said Yahoo was open to Microsoft all along but said he felt that the company he co-founded was simply worth more than what Microsoft put on the table.
articles.abstract: Jerry Yang said Yahoo was open to Microsoft all along but said he felt that the company he co-founded was simply worth more than what Microsoft put on the table.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  People involved in relationships that end abruptly often have grossly conflicting accounts of what went wrong. On Monday, Jerry Yang gave his version.
articles.byline: By Brad Stone and Miguel Helft

articles.headline: Chief of Random House Said to Be Stepping Down
articles.snippet: Peter W. Olson, one of the most powerful figures in American book publishing, will step down amid mounting pressure over declining profits at Random House.
articles.abstract: Peter W. Olson, one of the most powerful figures in American book publishing, will step down amid mounting pressure over declining profits at Random House.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  Peter W. Olson, the chief executive of Random House and one of the most powerful figures in American book publishing, will step down in the next few weeks, according to two executives at Bertelsmann, the German media conglomerate that owns the division.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Motoko Rich

articles.headline: States Get In on Calls for a Gas Tax Holiday
articles.snippet: State gas taxes often add far more to the price of gas than the 18.4-cent federal excise tax.
articles.abstract: State gas taxes often add far more to the price of gas than the 18.4-cent federal excise tax.
articles.lead_paragraph: SLOCOMB, Ala. — Gov. Charlie Crist of Florida has been fighting to cut 10 cents from the state’s gasoline tax for two weeks in July. Lawmakers in Missouri, New York and Texas have also proposed a summer break from state gas taxes, while candidates for governor in Indiana and North Carolina are sparring over relief ideas of their own.
